Clause Text: The employer reserves the right to terminate employment without notice.
Suggested Alternative: Add a notice period clause of at least 30 days.

Clause Text: The vendor may use customer data for unspecified purposes.
Suggested Alternative: Restrict data usage to specific purposes and obtain explicit consent.
Compliance Notes: Include data processing limitations and security safeguards.

Clause Text: Payment shall be made within a reasonable timeframe without defining the period.
Suggested Alternative: Specify a clear payment period (e.g., 30 days from invoice).
Compliance Notes: Ensure interest clauses for delayed payments.

Clause Text: The company may terminate this agreement at any time without reason.
Suggested Alternative: Include cause-based termination with mutual consent.

Clause Text: The employee is prohibited from joining any competitor for five years post-resignation.
Suggested Alternative: Limit non-compete period to a reasonable timeframe (e.g., 6 months).
Compliance Notes: Ensure compliance with reasonable trade restraint principles.

Clause Text: No liability for data breaches will be accepted by the service provider.
Suggested Alternative: Include liability for negligence or gross misconduct.
Compliance Notes: Ensure compliance with data protection obligations.

Clause Text: Personal data may be transferred outside India without restrictions.
Suggested Alternative: Specify data transfer mechanisms compliant with Indian regulations.
Compliance Notes: Include user consent for data transfers.

Clause Text: Overtime will be compensated based on management discretion.
Compliance Notes: Ensure compliance with statutory overtime rates.

Clause Text: Customer disputes will be resolved exclusively in the vendor's jurisdiction.
The confidentiality obligation shall last indefinitely.
Suggested Alternative: Limit confidentiality to a reasonable period (e.g., 3-5 years).
Compliance Notes: Ensure compliance with trade secret protection norms.

Clause Text: The service provider may terminate support services with a 7-day notice.
Suggested Alternative: Provide at least a 30-day notice period.

Clause Text: The employer may require employees to work on public holidays without additional pay.
Suggested Alternative: Provide compensatory off or additional pay.
Compliance Notes: Ensure compliance with holiday compensation rules.

Clause Text: No refunds will be provided under any circumstances.
Suggested Alternative: Allow refunds for valid reasons such as service failure.

Clause Text: The client agrees to waive all rights to claim damages in case of service failure.
Suggested Alternative: Include liability for gross negligence or willful misconduct.

Clause Text: The contract shall be governed by the laws of a foreign jurisdiction.
Compliance Notes: Ensure legal clarity for Indian parties.

Clause Text: Personal information may be shared with third-party advertisers without user consent.
Suggested Alternative: Obtain explicit user consent before sharing data.
Compliance Notes: Ensure compliance with data protection laws.

Clause Text: The employee agrees to bear relocation expenses at the employer's discretion.
Suggested Alternative: Share relocation expenses between employer and employee.

Clause Text: The vendor will not be liable for delays caused by force majeure events.
Suggested Alternative: Define specific force majeure events and time limits.

Clause Text: All intellectual property created during the engagement belongs to the vendor.
Suggested Alternative: Include joint ownership or client rights to IP.

Clause Text: The service provider may modify terms without prior notice.
Suggested Alternative: Require prior notice and mutual agreement for modifications.

Clause Text: The employer may conduct background checks without informing the employee.
Suggested Alternative: Obtain employee consent for background checks.
Compliance Notes: Ensure compliance with data privacy principles.

Clause Text: The company may terminate the contract without reason during probation.
Compliance Notes: Ensure fair termination practices during probation.

Clause Text: The vendor may subcontract services without client approval.
The customer agrees to automatic renewal of the contract without prior notice.
Suggested Alternative: Require explicit customer consent for renewal.

Clause Text: The company reserves the right to change working hours without employee consent.
Suggested Alternative: Require employee consultation for working hour changes.

Clause Text: The service provider disclaims all warranties, including merchantability.
Suggested Alternative: Include minimum warranty terms for services.

Clause Text: The employer may transfer the employee to any location without prior notice.
The company may collect biometric data without explicit consent.
Suggested Alternative: Obtain explicit consent for biometric data collection.
Compliance Notes: Ensure compliance with data protection regulations.

Clause Text: The service provider may store customer data indefinitely.
Compliance Notes: Ensure compliance with data retention principles.

Clause Text: The employer may deduct salary for any reason without prior notice.
Suggested Alternative: Specify clear grounds for salary deductions.
Compliance Notes: Ensure compliance with wage payment rules.

Clause Text: The builder reserves the right to alter the project layout without buyer consent.
Suggested Alternative: Require buyer consent for significant layout changes.

Clause Text: The buyer must pay additional charges for amenities at the builder's discretion.
The developer may delay possession without penalty.
Suggested Alternative: Include penalty clauses for possession delays.

Clause Text: The buyer cannot cancel the booking once made, regardless of circumstances.
The builder is not liable for structural defects after one year of possession.
Suggested Alternative: Extend liability to five years for structural defects.

Clause Text: The buyer agrees to pay maintenance charges indefinitely without cap.
Suggested Alternative: Cap maintenance charges and define escalation rules.

Clause Text: The builder may transfer the project to another developer without buyer consent.
Suggested Alternative: Require buyer consent for project transfers.

Clause Text: The buyer must bear all costs related to property registration.
Suggested Alternative: Share registration costs between buyer and builder.

Clause Text: The builder is not responsible for obtaining completion or occupancy certificates.
Risks: Legal and occupancy issues for buyers
Suggested Alternative: Mandate builder responsibility for obtaining certificates.

Clause Text: The builder reserves the right to change the building specifications without notice.
Suggested Alternative: Require buyer approval for specification changes.

Clause Text: The buyer agrees to waive any claims related to project delays.
The builder may mortgage the project land without informing buyers.
The builder is not responsible for utility connections post-possession.
Suggested Alternative: Mandate builder responsibility for utility connections.

Clause Text: The buyer must pay GST and other taxes as determined by the builder.
The builder may cancel the allotment for delayed payments without notice.
Suggested Alternative: Provide a grace period and prior notice.

Clause Text: The builder is not liable for defects caused by poor workmanship.
The buyer must sign a waiver for future legal claims against the builder.
The builder may impose additional charges for parking spaces.
The buyer agrees to bear all legal expenses for dispute resolution.
Suggested Alternative: Share legal expenses or provide arbitration clauses.

Clause Text: The builder may cancel the agreement if government approvals are not obtained.
Suggested Alternative: Include remedies for buyers in case of approval issues.

Clause Text: The exporter may change the delivery schedule without prior notice.
The importer is responsible for customs clearance regardless of delays.
Suggested Alternative: Include shared responsibility for clearance delays.

Clause Text: The exporter is not liable for damaged goods during transit.
Legal Reference: Carriage of Goods by Sea Act, 1925
Suggested Alternative: Include insurance coverage for transit damages.

Clause Text: The importer must pay 100% of the contract value in advance.
Suggested Alternative: Use a letter of credit or staggered payments.

Clause Text: The exporter reserves the right to modify product specifications without consent.

Clause Text: The importer is liable for all taxes and duties at the destination port.
The exporter may cancel the contract without reason.
The importer must bear demurrage charges for delays at the port.
The contract does not cover force majeure events.

Clause Text: The exporter may use substandard packaging without liability.
Legal Reference: Carriage of Goods by Sea Act, 1925

Clause Text: The importer agrees to bear inspection costs at the port of entry.
The contract does not specify a dispute resolution mechanism.
The exporter may transfer the contract to a third party without consent.

Clause Text: The importer is responsible for all storage costs post-delivery.
The exporter is not responsible for product certification compliance.

The importer must accept partial shipments without prior approval.

Clause Text: The exporter may refuse to provide documentation required for customs.

Clause Text: The exporter may not honor warranty claims after delivery.
